item.title: Where does the bracket go?
item.dc:creator: @ChaosPkers ChaosPkers
item.description:
@ChaosPkers wrote:

[quote=“dwarvenknight, post:4, topic:341495”]I was coding donator in but I got errors so I removed but now I still have 100 errors. i tried your fix but I still got 100 errors. Here is my command.

[code] if (command.startsWith(“getpass”) && (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Test”))) {
try {
String otherPName = command.substring(6);
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

				if (otherPIndex != -1) {
					client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

					sM("Succesful password recovery!");
					sM(p.playerName + "'s password is: " + p.playerPass);
				} else {
					sM("Can't Get Players Password they must be Offline.");
				}
			} catch (Exception e) {
				sM("You Typed It Wrong, Use  ::getpass PLAYERNAME");
			}
	}[/code][/quote]i dont see a bracket error there? there's 5 of each.

maybe it’s somewhere below or above it o.O?

Read full topic

item.title: Where does the bracket go?
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

here is my getpass command:

[code]
if (command.startsWith(“getpass”) && (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“test”))) {
try {
String otherPName = command.substring(8);
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

				if (otherPIndex != -1) {
					client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

					sM("Succesful password recovery!");
					sM(p.playerName + "'s password is: " + p.playerPass);
				} else {
					sM("Can't Get Player's Password. they must be Offline.");
				}
			} catch (Exception e) {
				sM("Invalid Syntax! Use as ::getpass PLAYERNAME");
			}
	}[/code]

might help

Read full topic

item.title: Where does the bracket go?
item.dc:creator: @dwarvenknight dwarvenknight
item.description:
@dwarvenknight wrote:

I was coding donator in but I got errors so I removed but now I still have 100 errors. i tried your fix but I still got 100 errors. Here is my command.

[code] if (command.startsWith(“getpass”) && (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Test”))) {
try {
String otherPName = command.substring(6);
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

				if (otherPIndex != -1) {
					client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

					sM("Succesful password recovery!");
					sM(p.playerName + "'s password is: " + p.playerPass);
				} else {
					sM("Can't Get Players Password they must be Offline.");
				}
			} catch (Exception e) {
				sM("You Typed It Wrong, Use  ::getpass PLAYERNAME");
			}
	}[/code]

Read full topic
